Applying Ownership and Group Privileges

As an administrator, when you create a new server configuration, you must decide whether object ownership and/or group privileges should be factors in determining access to the projects managed by that configuration.

  • If object ownership applies, the user who creates an object within that configuration has complete access to the object. When ownership is not ignored, it takes precedence over both group privileges and access rights.

  • If group privileges apply, specific groups can be have the following privileges on all projects, views, folders, or items in the server configuration:

  • See object and its properties.

  • Modify object properties.

  • Delete object.

  • Purge object (not currently supported).

  • Acquire object ownership (not currently supported).

  • Change object access rights.

  • Create [new] object and place it in a container.

  • Grant all specific class-level rights for all classes of objects.

    • Group privileges override current access rights set for the objects in the application, but do not override object ownership, if it is being used.

If both object ownership and group privileges are ignored, only access rights determine who can and who cannot perform operations on objects.

To use or ignore object ownership and/or group privileges:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane.  If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can access remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the System Policy shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > System Policy.

      • These actions display the System Policy dialog.

  4. Click on the Access Rights tab.

  5. From the Access validation options group box:

    • Select or clear the Ignore object ownership check box. When cleared, the server configuration checks for object ownership.

    • Select or clear the Ignore group privileges check box. When cleared, the server configuration checks for group privileges.

  6. Click OK.
